thread.title: Mark Clattenburg to leave Premier League - Twitter reacts | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Mark Clattenburg to leave Premier League - Twitter reacts | Daily Mail Online

author: Daniel Matthews For Mailonline
title: Mark Clattenburg to leave Premier League - Twitter reacts | Daily Mail Online
text: Published: 17:44 GMT, 16 February 2017 | Updated: 17:44 GMT, 16 February 2017 892 shares comments Mark Clattenburg's Premier League career has come to an end. The move comes at the end of a stellar year for the official, who last season took charge of the FA Cup final, Champions League final and EURO 2016 final between France and Portugal. Mark Clattenburg is leaving English football to become the head of referees in Saudi Arabia Clattenburg first took charge of a professional match in 2000 aged just 25 - which was then a post-war record. And after rising to the top of his profession domestically, the official is going global - cashing in on the chance to become Saudi Arabia's new head of referees. His favourite artist Ed Sheeran once wrote: 'Oh no, no, don't leave me alone lonely now'. And social media has been awash with tributes to a referee who reportedly insisted players called him 'mate'. Here Sportsmail looks at the best of the reaction...
